Union_City.Temple B'Nai Abraham:
Temple B'nai Abraham (also known as Deliverance Temple and Deliverance Evangelistic Center) is a historic synagogue and church building at 621 Clinton Avenue in Newark, Essex County, New Jersey, United States. It was designed by Newark architect Nathan Myers who later designed the iconic Hersch Tower in Elizabeth.
It was built in 1924 and added to the National Register of Historic Places in 2007.
